TopicTitle: The Lunex Challenge for KSP 1.10 (Now with badges!)

Articles.Content:
Here's my entry for LUNEX-1:

This is my very first video ever for which I did a voice-over; I think it's kind of cringey but I figured I'll never learn to do a proper one if I don't just try it, so there you have it.

I did this without parking orbits of any kind. So a direct munshot, direct landing (well, technically I entered Munar orbit momentarily during my braking burn) and direct ascent back to Kerbin, with a landing on the KSC runway. Landing on the runway took a few attempts to get the timing right, as the maneuver node planner is useless if your ship is on the surface.

I also took some inspiration from the LUNEX proposal linked earlier in the thread: it mentions that a liquid-fueled booster will be developed, but that a solid rocket is acceptable as a substitute. So my launch vehicle simply consisted of a Clydesdale booster, with a Kerbin departure stage and lander on top, As you can see from the thumbnail, my re-entry vehicle was inspired by another USAF project, the X-20 Dyna-Soar.

This is almost fully stock. I have both DLCs but only used Making History for this craft (specifically, the Clydesdale). I also used the suicide burn timer from Kerbal Engineer Redux for the landing. As you can see I have various "cheat" mods like Hyperedit and Vessel Mover installed, but I only used those during testing, not during the actual mission.

Edited August 16, 2020 by QF9E

On 8/14/2020 at 6:47 AM, minerbat said:

Done!

 

Congrats on completing Mun Lunex 1, First Class, @minerbat!

On 8/14/2020 at 7:16 AM, minerbat said:

2 Questions: The description of lunex 1 first class say that I need to land at the KSC, which is understandable for the first mission to get extra challenging. But the other first class descriptions don't have this requirement. So I don't need to land at the KSC every time? I hope so because it would just get tedious while the actual first class extra challenging part comes from some other requirement and I did prove i can land at the runway, I just don't feel like spending al that time on such a small detail because it costed about half of my mission time (I am very proud on myself for pulling it off ). Also, is the breaking ground DLC allowed?

You don't have to land on the runway every time, no, but keep in mind that it is a lot easier to land a craft with wheels on the runway than pretty much anywhere on Kerbin.

All DLC is allowed.

This is a really fun challenge. Now on to part 2!

Congrats on completing Mun Lunex 1, First Class, @xub313

Quick question, is using trajectories okay for mission 1 first class. I assume it is but makes the entry modded.

@catloaf Only parts mods make a mission modded for the purposes of this challenge. Totally allowed.

This is my very first video ever for which I did a voice-over; I think it's kind of cringey but I figured I'll never learn to do a proper one if I don't just try it, so there you have it.

I did this without parking orbits of any kind. So a direct munshot, direct landing (well, technically I entered Munar orbit momentarily during my braking burn) and direct ascent back to Kerbin, with a landing on the KSC runway. Landing on the runway took a few attempts to get the timing right, as the maneuver node planner is useless if your ship is on the surface.

I also took some inspiration from the LUNEX proposal linked earlier in the thread: it mentions that a liquid-fueled booster will be developed, but that a solid rocket is acceptable as a substitute. Edited August 16, 2020 by KingDominoIII
@KingDominoIII I have a question: Is it allowed to combine multiple Missions like Mun Lunex 1 and Mun Lunex 2 as an example? Because Mun Lunex 2 is basically Mun Lunex 1 with a rover.

My LUNEX-2 mission:

I flew exactly the same profile as LUNEX-1, and I landed just a few hundred meters from LUNEX-1 on the Mun. I used exactly the same rocket, with one difference: I moved the lander stage engines to the sides to make room for cargo between them. Despite a few tons of extra payload in the form of a pressurized rover, fuel loadout was exactly the same, as I had quite a lot of fuel reserves on LUNEX-1.

I agree with @s_gamer101 on optionally combining the LUNEX-1 and -2 missions (perhaps like the STS-1a and -1b missions in the Shuttle Challenge?). These missions are very much the same. This is also why I did not feel inspired to do commentary on my LUNEX-2 video, as I felt I had said everything that needed to be said about the mission already..

Here's my entry for lunex 1:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kgpQe56csyEdn8AEwhyQCI7sSfdAxQ6O/view?usp=sharing

sorry for the bad editing.

This challenge is very interesting going to definitely do this! Now to the VAB!!!

Edit: I got a spacecraft! Going to have a hard time landing at Runway. Might do multiple passes to get to LKO then land then...

@KingDominoIII Question about the third Mun mission: must the base be returned to Kerbin with the re-entry vehicle, or can you fly it back on its own? I've built this thing:

which is about 2 tons, like my rover from LUNEX-2, so it should be trivial to get it to the Mun on my existing LUNEX craft. And it can fly back on its own, re-enter and land. But my question is: is this what you had in mind?

2 hours ago, QF9E said:

Please tell me you joined me in the "I landed on top of the Neil Armstrong Memorial" club! Click on my KSP Apollo badge for details.

I didn't land on top of it but next to it, my craft is a little too big for that. But the appollo memorial is an extra special location for me because my first madden mun mission landed very close without me knowing it was there, they brought a small unmanned rover with them so when they were gone and I was driving my rover around I saw a few weird gray pixels in the distance, kind of the same as when you look at minmus from kerbin. So i drived my rover over there and found the memorial. Quite a small change of landing just a few km away from it so I was lucky. I always wanted to visit it with kerbals so that is what I did! I also think it was wat my first forum post was about

Here's my entry for Lunex 2 first class. 

Hopefully that cargo elevator will be useful for the next few missions so I can reuse the same craft. This was my first time using the Breaking Ground robotic parts too. It was a lot of fun!
